title: Default Credentials
description: The device is using factory-default login credentials (username and password). Default credentials are publicly known and documented, making it trivial for attackers to gain unauthorized access to the device. This is one of the most common and dangerous security issues found in home and small office networks.
remediation:
1. Access the device's administration interface
2. Navigate to the user or password settings
3. Change the default username if possible
4. Set a strong, unique password (at least 12 characters with mixed case, numbers, and symbols)
5. Enable two-factor authentication if available
6. Document the new credentials securely
